response_text: Yes — there are Windows apps and tools that provide live translation (captions/subtitles or voice) during calls in Google Meet and other meeting apps:  ✅ Built-in Options (no extra app needed, but platform-specific)  Google Meet has its own live caption + translation feature built in (translations show as captions in chosen languages). Fora Soft [https://www.forasoft.com/blog/article/multilingual-translation-video-calls]  Zoom offers translated captions and AI-driven live transcript translation for many languages. Zoom+1 [https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0060844]  Microsoft Teams supports live translated captions and interpretation features (built into Teams with proper plan). Microsoft Support+1 [https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/use-live-captions-in-microsoft-teams-meetings-4be2d304-f675-4b57-8347-cbd000a21260]  These work without a separate Windows application, but may require enabling in settings or a paid plan.  ✅ Third-party Windows apps/tools for live translation across meetings  These run on Windows and work with Google Meet, Zoom, Teams, etc.  1) JotMe  Desktop app for Windows.  Captures audio and provides real-time translation + transcription in your chosen languages.  Works across meetings without needing a bot. JotMe [https://www.jotme.io/]  2) Talo AI  Real-time AI translator that integrates with Google Meet, Teams, Zoom.  Translates speech live into captions during calls. Talo [https://taloai.com/]  3) Wordly AI / Wordly Translation Agent  A bot/app that can join meetings and provide live captions and translated subtitles across platforms. Wordly [https://www.wordly.ai/ai-translation-agent]  4) Transync AI  Windows desktop translator that captures audio from any meeting and displays translated text/voice. 同言翻译 [https://www.transyncai.com/tools/live-meeting-translation/]  5) Akkadu AI Live Captions  Windows software for live captioning and translation in many languages on any platform. Akkadu [https://akkadu.ai/]  6) Deeptrue / Deeptrue Translation tools  Provides floating translated captions during Google Meet/Zoom calls on Windows. Deeptrue+1 [https://www.deeptrue.org/teams/teams-translation]  ➤ Browser extensions (helpful but not full desktop apps)  Real-time translation caption extensions for Chrome (works with Google Meet/Zoom), e.g., Real-Time Video & Audio Translation or Felo Subtitles. Chrome Web Store+1 [https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/real-time-video-audio-tra/cbokniolkggbjffkamfkloblcjckdohp?hl=en-US]  TL;DR  Built-in translation: Google Meet, Zoom, Teams each offer live translated captions (sometimes behind pay tiers). Fora Soft+1 [https://www.forasoft.com/blog/article/multilingual-translation-video-calls]  Windows apps that work across platforms: JotMe, Talo, Wordly AI, Transync AI, Akkadu, Deeptrue provide real-time translation/captions during calls. JotMe+1 [https://www.jotme.io/]  If you want recommendations for the simplest install + easiest use for Google Meet specifically, let me know.
